name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Review all drawings and documentation provided to the Contractor.
Acceptance Criteria - Prior to the commencement of Works it must be ensure that all necessary documentation has been provided.
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - All setting out shall be performed by or under the control of a licensed surveyor, who shall certify the accuracy of key dimensions of the as constructed works. Specs 1000: 3.2.4
Acceptance Criteria - Levels and allignment Set Out matches marks shown on the Drawings, 2D data and linework provided or agreed with the Engineer
Verifying Document - Compliance surveys or spot checks
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Gate valves shall comply with AS/NZS 2638. Valves greater than DN50 shall be resilient seated sluice valves. DN50 shall be gate valves. Sluice valves shall be anti-clockwise closing. DN50 gate valves shall be clockwise closing. Valves shall be provided with a surface box according to the asset owner’s engineering standards. Specs 1131: 14.3.1
Acceptance Criteria - The charasteritics of the valves delivered to site match the corresponding specifications, drawings details or approved equivalent
Verifying Document - Delivery docket, Supplier certificate, Photo
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - All joints and fittings must comply with wath is estipulated on Specs 1131: 14.3.2
Acceptance Criteria - The charasteritics of the fittings delivered to site match the corresponding specifications, drawings details or approved equivalent
Verifying Document - Delivery docket, Supplier certificate, Photo
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pipe bedding should be AP20 and in accordance with AS/NZS 2566.2 or AS/NZA 3725. Maximum Dry Density (MDD) and Optimum Water Content (OWC) of the aggregate must be provided. Specs 1131: 14.9.1
Acceptance Criteria - Visual Inspection, Engineer approval
Verifying Document - Delivery Docket, Laboratory test results
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, Lab Test

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Backfill aggregate should be GAP 65. Samples of backfill material should be tested in accordence of NZS 4402 to determine the MDD at OMC. The solid density of aggregate should be tested in accordance with NZS 4407. Specs 1131: 16.1.1
Acceptance Criteria - Visual Inspection, Engineer approval
Verifying Document - Delivery Docket, Laboratory test results
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, Lab Test
3.7 - Concrete Manhole, Catchpits and Access Chambers
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Precast concrete estructures shall comply with NZS 3106. Specs 1131: 14.5
Acceptance Criteria - Manhole charasteritics Match NZS 3106
Verifying Document - Delivery docket, Supplier certificate, Photo
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Storage for materiales must be arranged as it is described in: Specs 1131: 14.10
Acceptance Criteria - Pipe stored according to specifications
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Any materials that do not comply with this specification or that have been damaged as a result of the Contractor’s operations shall be removed from site and replaced at the Contractor’s expense. Repairs may be considered at the sole discretion of the Engineer. Specs 1131: 14.12
Acceptance Criteria - Defective material detected and removed from site
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Contaminated soils (Type H materials) encountered shall be treated and/or disposed off site in accordance with statutory requirements. Specs 1110: 9.3
Acceptance Criteria - Dumping site approval for contamiantion type
Frequency - If constaminated soils are found
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Trenches for flexible pipes shall be excavated within tollerances in table from Specs 1131: 15.2.5 unless otherwise stated.
Acceptance Criteria - Trench width and pipe clearance to walls comply with requirements
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, Measurement Check

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Bedding and Haunching for flexible pipes should be in accordance with AS/NZS 2556.2 and have minimum embedment zone as shown in table from Specs 1131: 15.2.8.2
Acceptance Criteria - Bedding and haunching high and with comply width requirements
Frequency - During bedding and haunching installation
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, Measurement Check

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pipes shall be laid true to the design line and level within the tolerances specified in Specs 1131: 15.9. Invert levels shall take precedence over depths. Specs 1131: 15.3.12
Acceptance Criteria - Pipe levels are within the tolerance and according to the drawings, 2D data and linework provided or agreed with the Engineer

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Joints between precast pipe units shall be self-centering and shall be sealed with butyl mastic or similar approved to form a watertight joint. Concrete pipes shall be installed in accordance with AS/NZS 3725. Specs 1131: 15.3.6
Acceptance Criteria - Precast concrete pipes Joints and Intallation comply with standard and specifications
Frequency - Per joint, and during pipe installation

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Compaction shall be as stated in Specs 1131: 15.4.4. For concrete pipes the verification testing of compaction shall use a method recommended in table 3 of the CPAA Technical Note on Installing Concrete Pipe and approved by the Engineer. Specs 1131: 15.3.6
Acceptance Criteria - Compaction Value ≥ Specification Value
Verifying Document - Depending of Pipe material or Aggregate: CBR Checksheet, Nuclear Density Meter (NDM) Results Sheet, Clegg Hamer test records
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - On site Test

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Selected fill within 0.8m depth from finished surface shall be AP 65. Subgrade and subbase shall be compacted in layers no greater than 200 mm thick unless otherwise agreed with the Engineer. Under carriageway basecourse shall be compacted in layers no greater than 150mm thick unless otherwise aggred with the engineer. Specs 1131: 15.4.3.2, 15.4.3.3
Verifying Document - Nuclear Density Meter (NDM) Results Sheet or Clegg Hamer test records
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - On site Test

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Topsoil shall be used to dress areas disturbed by the contrat works to a minimum thickness of 100mm. Grass seed shall be sown evenly over the prepared topsoil area. Specs 1131: 15.8.6
Acceptance Criteria - Topsoil installed and grass seed spread in the specified rate and mixture.
Frequency - After compaction of final layer of backfill

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - In accordance with manufactures specifications. Where unspecified butt welding in accordance with PIPA POP003 and electrofusion welding in accordance with PIPA POP001. All welds shall be marked with weld number and welder identification. Specs 1131: 15.3.2.1.
Acceptance Criteria - PE Welding ejectuded as specified
Verifying Document - QA records, Weld records

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Each butt-welded joint will be visually inspected by the engineer and Each electrofusion joint shall be visually inspected by the contractor according to Specs 1131: 16.3.2.1
Acceptance Criteria - Welded Joints complies with visual inspection specified
Verifying Document - QA records, Weld records, Photo
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, Measurement Check
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Where a pipe is built into an underground structure, the requirements stipulated in Specs 1131: 15.3.10 must be followed
Acceptance Criteria - Pipe is connected to the structures according to the specifications
Verifying Document - Methodology, QA records, Photos
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, Measurement Check

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Two hard copies and one electronic copy of As-built drawings shall be prepared in draft and final versions following Schedule 1D in NZS4404:2010. Specs 1000: 3.9.2

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Manholes should be tested seperately to pipeline for water tightness up to lower rim of manhole cover frame. Testing shall be in the presence of the engineer. Specs 1131: 16.2.2.5
Acceptance Criteria - A maximum drop in water level over 30 min should not exceed 2mL/hr/mm of diameter/meter height of the manhole. Engineer Approval
Frequency - For every manhole installed (24hr prior notice to the engineer before test)
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - All pipelines shall pass a CCTV inspection. All pipelines shall be free of debris and flushed 24hrs prior to inspection. Specs 1131: 16.2.3
Acceptance Criteria - A pipeline will fail its inspection if:
– The pipe is horizontally misaligned or deformed by more than 5 % of the pipe diameter.
– The pipe has visible dips or ponding of water.
– The pipe has visible defects, such as open or displaced joints, defective or protruding laterals, cracked barrels or similar defects.
– There is evidence of infiltration at joints or laterals.
Verifying Document - CCTV footage and log sheets
Frequency - At every section of pipe installed.

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - All surplus, redundant and faulty materials must be removed from the Site and dispose of them in a safe and legal manner. Any demolition material or rubbish coming from the execution of the project must be removed as well. Specs 1000: 3.13.2

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Completed items of construction about to be placed in service or occupied for their intended use must be properly and thoroughly cleaned of all foreign matter and other debris. Specs 1000: 3.13.3
